snippet: After a successful showing in last week’s election, Beppe Grillo, a comedian turned activist, is being courted by Italy’s traditional political players, with whom he has refused to play ball.
abstract: Beppe Grillo, Italian comedian turned activist whose populist party has made successful showing in national election, typifies new breed of reformist leftist politician emerging out of Europe's long-running economic crisis and voter discontent; joins growing number of politicians whose refusal to play ball with establishment powers that they consider corrupt has become worrying to European Union officials.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Rome, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Marina di Bibbona, Italy.

lead_paragraph: After a successful showing in last week’s election, Beppe Grillo, a comedian turned activist, is being courted by Italy’s traditional political players, with whom he has refused to play ball.

headline.seo: Beppe Grillo, Italy’s Gadfly, Reflects a Movement
headline.main: A Jester No More, Italy’s Gadfly of Politics Reflects a Movement
headline.print_headline: A Jester No More, Italy’s Gadfly Tosses Its Politics Into Turmoil
